intro: Sonerila bensonii, commonly known as the Bornean flame vine, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its vibrant orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy surface, while its stems are woody and climbing. Sonerila bensonii is often found growing along forest edges or in disturbed areas, showcasing its adaptability to diverse environments.
